preface.title: The Good Shepherd
preface.para: The tracking and shepherding of animals are fundamental activities of all modern and prehistoric human civilizations. Either for hunting or husbandry human beings have always observed and remembered animal movements. Today with larger herds and more movements computer based tools to track animal movements can ease the burden and reduce the cost for farm animal producers and livestock infrastructure providers.

section.title: Description
section.para: Tracker models animal event histories for farm animal producers and/or livestock infrastructure providers. Model documents are displayed and manipulated with Tracker Editors, Wizards, and various Importing and Exporting utilities.

section.title: Modeling the Premises
section.para: Computers can be thought of as mechanisms or containers for modeling an aspect of the real world. The Tracker software application models the events associated with animals on the premises of a farm or a livestock infrastructure provider.

chapter.title: Querying and Selecting Tracker Model Objects

section.title: OCL Introduction
section.para: The Object Constraint Language, OCL is a simple declarative language for specifying rules that apply to document models. Within Tracker, documents model an Agricultural Premises that contain Animals and an EventHistory of significant Events that happen to these Animals.
Within Tracker Editors OCL rules can be used to both query and select specific information about the Animals and the Events that have taken place on the Premises.
